key_channel_insights.line_content: Over 60% of OTA fares match the direct site, with OTA-lower instances under 1%.
Over 99% of itineraries are cheaper on MSE, at 6–8% below direct fares.
Around two-thirds of fares match, while roughly one-third are higher on GDS.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: OTA Lower appears in under 0.1% of cases across nearly all categories, indicating minimal undercutting.
OTA N/A remains below 1% but rose by 15% vs. the previous week, largely driven by short-haul segments.
Over 60% of fares match on this channel, signifying strong parity with the airline’s website.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Rare at just 0.68% last week, though it experienced a 15% jump from the prior week.
Holds the majority at around 62% last week, with a gradual decline of nearly 4% compared to last month.
Represented roughly 37% last week and continues to climb, up nearly 2% from the previous week.
Extremely rare, below 1% in all measured periods, with no significant shifts.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Around 39% of fares are OTA Higher and 60% match last week; minimal OTA Lower presence.
All fares matched at 100% for the last week, with no observations of OTA Higher or Lower.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: OTA Higher stands at 43% last week, up around 2% vs. the prior week and over 4% vs. last month.
SAME dominates at nearly 98% last week, with OTA Higher remaining below 1%.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Approx. 73% matched last week, while 26% were OTA Higher and no measurable OTA Lower.
Over half of fares appeared OTA Higher (59%), with only 41% matching and a negligible OTA Lower share.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE undercuts the direct site over 99% of the time, highlighting strong fare competitiveness.
Average savings hover around 6% on short haul and 8% on long haul.
Fares not found on MSE have declined from last week to almost zero.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Now virtually 0% at the all-dimension level, indicating broad coverage improvement.
Less than 0.3% of itineraries show identical fares, with no notable shift.
Over 99% of flights are cheaper via MSE, typically 6–8% below the airline.
No instances recorded of MSE exceeding the direct site.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 99.6% cheaper on MSE, offering around -6% price difference.
Every tracked itinerary is cheaper, at roughly -8% compared to the airline.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Lower in 99.6% of cases, with discounts near -6% and minimal unlisted fares.
Fully cheaper at 100% last week and this week, up to -8% price difference.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: MSE remains cheaper ~99.7% of the time, maintaining a -6% fare gap.
100% cheaper this week, consistently showing around -6% below direct fares.

gds_highlights.line_content: Around two-thirds of GDS fares match website rates, holding stable near 63–66% over the past month.
Roughly one-third of fares are priced higher on GDS, declining slightly from 37% to 33% compared to the previous month.
A tiny fraction, below 1%, is cheaper on GDS, showing negligible changes week over week.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Remains below 0.3% across key comparisons, indicating minimal missing website fares in GDS.
Dominant at over 60% with a slight drop of about 3.6% vs last month.
Steady near one-third of fares, with a modest downward shift from last month.
Stays below 0.2%, confirming rare instances of cheaper GDS pricing.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: About 61% are the same; over 38% are higher, while GDS-lower occurrences remain below 1%.
All checked itineraries show perfect parity with website fares.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Nearly 57% match while around 43% are higher, showing a mild shift toward parity over the month.
Almost all fares (99.46%) match; a marginal 0.54% are higher, indicating strong alignment with website.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 74% match, 26% are higher, and less than 1% are lower in near-term bookings.
58% are higher and 42% match, with no notable cheaper fares reported at longer booking windows.
